snippet: A group representing cab operators says there are more questions than answers after an agreement to make half of taxis wheelchair accessible by 2020.
abstract: Announcement that New York City has settled class-action lawsuit that, if approved, would result in at least half of its taxicabs becoming wheelchair accessible by 2020, draws praise from politicians, industry figures and advocates for the disabled; some, however, are questioning practicalities of how deal will be put into effect.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

lead_paragraph: A group representing cab operators says there are more questions than answers after an agreement to make half of taxis wheelchair accessible by 2020.

headline.main: Wheelchair Settlement Poses Test for Cab Industry
headline.print_headline: Wheelchair Settlement Poses Test for Cab Industry
